posts.content: I see.Try restoring your Iphone using Itunes as follows:1. Connect Iphone to computer using USB cable.2. Open Itunes program on your computer.3. On Iphone, press Home and Power button on the same time and release the power button after 10 seconds but continue to hold Home button until Itunes shows it has detected Iphone in recovery mode.4. Click OK to restore.I hope this helps.

posts.title: Expert
posts.content: Please follow those steps:Put your iPhone to DFU (Device Firmware Upgrade) Mode and try to restore it from iTunes. Follow the steps below to put your iPhone to DFU Mode:1. Connect the iPhone to your computer with the USB Cable.2. Open iTunes application on your computer3. On your iPhone Press and hold the Home button and the Sleep/Wake button at the same time.4. After exactly 8 seconds (when apple logo disappear) release the Sleep/Wake button. Continue holding the home button until your iTunes shows a message telling you that it has detected an iPhone.5. Click OK or Restore.Please note that in DFU Mode your iPhone will remain blank.If iTunes recognize your phone in recovery mode, please repeat the steps above to put your phone in DFU mode.Let me know if that works please. Thanks!

question.title: My iphone 3g will not turn on, plug in the charger and the
question.content: My iphone 3g will not turn on, plug in the charger and the red battery shows with the charging symbol. Tried replacing the battery and docking connector assy but still the same. The battery has 3.5v in it and have tried the hard reset but still the same, won't switch on the battery is always red. Also tried plugging into a computer with iTunes but it does not show. What could be the problem
